snippet: The Lexington County sheriff, James Metts, 68, the state’s longest-serving sheriff, pleaded not guilty to federal bribery charges on Tuesday and was released on $100,000 bond.
abstract: Lexington County Sheriff James Metts, South Carolina's longest-serving sheriff, pleads not guilty to federal bribery charges and is released on $100,000 bond.
lead_paragraph: The Lexington County sheriff, James Metts, 68, the state’s longest-serving sheriff, pleaded not guilty to federal bribery charges on Tuesday and was released on $100,000 bond.

headline.main: South Carolina: Longtime Sheriff Charged With Bribery and Fraud
headline.print_headline: South Carolina: Longtime Sheriff Charged With Bribery and Fraud
